definition:
A map $f:X\to Y$ between quasi-affine varieties
$X\subset k^n,Y\subset k^m$ over a field $k$ is called ** if there is a
map $f':k^n\to k^m$ whose component functions are polynomials, such that
$f'$ restricts to $f$ on $X$.

Alternatively, $f$ is algebraic if the pullback map $f^*:C(Y)\to C(X)$
maps the coordinate ring of $Y$, $k[Y]$, to the coordinate ring of $X$,
$k[X]$.
